basics.name: Lucas de Assis Rosa
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Lucas (he/him/his) remotely from Brazil. Software Engineer with 5+ years of experience, focused on the Frontend. Developing high quality UIs with JQuery, AngularJS, Angular and React in fast-paced environments. My dream is to impact millions!

work.summary: Software Engineer focused on Frontend. Contributing to a variety of projects using Javascript, React, Redux, Angular, and CSS/SCSS, creating custom visual components and solutions for a range of projects including public-facing and internal tools. Actively contributing to evolve and maintain UI design systems, creating an adaptive and scalable stack.
highlights: Ahead of a major revamp, developing an auto-generated mechanism for API Examples
Improved bug tracking and error reporting using bugsnag and slack with prometheus alerts for the Public API documentation website
Developed and released the first version of the Telnyx Node SDK with high test coverage
Improved deployment pipeline for frontend projects through docker multi-step layer and monorepo deps caching
Worked telnyx.com website server rewrite for performance, improving image optimization, integrating with the frontend monorepo shared libraries and improving deploy pipeline caching
Worked on migrating from AngularJS and Angular to React in the Mission Control Portal project, maintaining feature parity, unit testing coverage and adding e2e specs
Onboarded several new frontend developers from different tech and culture backgrounds into the company and frontend projects. Updated documentation and improved the onboarding process

work.summary: Software Developer Consultant focused on Frontend Development. Worked with Javascript React and SCSS, along with Ruby on Rails. Contributed to Open Source Projects.
highlights: Contributed to Error Tools fixes and Frameworks docs
Working on a partial-remote team basis, along with the Bio Ritmo Microgyms
Created interfaces along with a high test coverage. Either using Jest or Mocha + Chai, Along with Enzyme & Sinon/React Testing Library techs were used and tailored to the project needs
Developed NodeJS Restful APIs for company internal projects
Concepted, planned, developed and presented a React GraphQL Client project using Apollo Client and React Apollo for BioRitmo to use on gym totens
Worked with Server Side Rendering in Rails, exploring pre-rendering with SEO and Performance optimization

work.description: Software Company Leader in Brazilian ERP Market
work.summary: Worked on the Engineering and Framework team which focused on high quality software development and scaffolding development using the best practices for a complex large scale product.
highlights: Engineering and Framework Team Member, developing WinThor Anywhere (WTA), a large-scale microservices-oriented web platform for an ERP solution, creating reference code base
Working on a partial-remote team basis, along with the Bio Ritmo Microgyms
Developed the Java back-end platform core and Restful APIs, on the top of Apache Karaf, in a OSGi Environment
Used technologies like  Spring, Maven, JDBC, JUnit, Mockito, Shiro and Jackson
Developed front-end projects in AngularJS and Angular 2+, on top of the TOTVS HTML Framework (THF), with CSS3
Started a micro-services structure with a build and deploy process (gulp, bower) for each project inside the WinThor Anywhere
Conducted in-company training on Java, AngularJS and THF, Spring and OSGi features
Created WTA reference code base, technical and software product documentation
Developed features and deployed mobile Android and iOS Apps using Java and Swift

work.summary: Researched and proved a system to hijack and insert data into an iSCSI stream.
highlights: Created a Python CLI tool under the iSCSI Packet Injection Research Project - https://github.com/illinoistech-itm/pykkon

work.summary: Developed a Jira plugin in Javascript and in Java, based on the Atlassian Jira SDK and Jira Plugins2 API. The plugin goal was to generate Sprint velocity reports using the c3.js library.
